content.question: Which of the following best explains how wolves are a keystone species in this ecosystem?

choices.label: Wolves help balance the population sizes of other species, allowing more species to thrive in the wolves’ presence than in their absence.
Wolves prey on certain species, increasing competition among other species, which results in a decrease in biodiversity in the ecosystem.
Wolves are not affected by factors that typically limit the population size; therefore their population can grow exponentially, increasing the demand on the parks’ resources.
Wolves prey on other species without having any natural predators themselves; therefore their presence significantly decreases many populations within the community.

content.answer: Wolves help balance the population sizes of other species, allowing more species to thrive in the wolves’ presence than in their absence.
